oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bailey School librarian and student workers, 1954 November 08
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Mrs. Wilma Folwell, librarian, and the student library assistants on the steps of Bailey School in 1954. Bailey School, built in 1929, is located in the Eastwood neighborhood of East Nashville. The student library assistants were responsible for shelving books, filing cards, and arranging bulletin boards. Older students were designated as 'library helpers' to assist children in lower grades with book selection, word recognition and learned to work with teachers and other students. Forms part of the Nashville Room Historic Photographs Collection. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Folwell, Wilma
